x-label: Incidence of psychosis per 100,000
y-label: % of those 16 or older who have used cannabis in the last week
title_yes: Cannabis use is associated with increased incidence of psychosis
title_no: There is no relationship between cannabis use and psychosis

x-label: Average adult male height (cm)
title_yes: Adult male height can be used as a predictor of GDP per capita
title_no: There is no relationship between GDP per capita and average make height

x-label: Percentage of obese adults
title_yes: Higher GDP per capita is associated with increased obesity
title_no: There is no association between obesity and GDP per capita

x-label: Percentage of young people going on to higher education
y-label: Average temperature of home country (degrees C)
title_yes: Being from a warmer country is associated with being less likely to go into higher education
title_no: There is no relationship between the temperature of your home country and how likely you are to go into higher education

x-label: Incidence of twins born (per 1000 births)
title_yes: Being from a rich country is associated with mothers having fewer twins
title_no: There is no association between GDP per capita and more twins being born

x-label: Times played for the England football team
title_yes: The older you get, the more you play
title_no: There is no relationship between the age of the player and the number of times they have played for England

x-label: Percentage of A*s achieved at GCSE
title_yes: Children from richer households get better GCSEs
title_no: There is no relationship between household income and GCSE achievment

x-label: Average time spent on a plane per year (hours)
title_yes: People from richer countries fly more
title_no: There is no association between GDP per capita and time spent on planes

x-label: Number of top 40 singles
title_yes: The longer your band plays, the more top 40 singles you're likely to have
title_no: Time active as a band does not predict the number of top 40 singles you get

x-label: Percentage of people with sight difficulties
y-label: Distance from the equator (thousands of miles)
title_yes: The closer you live to the equator, the more likely you are to have sight difficulties
title_no: Living close to the equator has no relation with incidence of sigh difficulties

x-label: Chocolate eaten per person per year (kg)
title_yes: Rich countries consume more chocolate
title_no: How rich your country is has nothing to do with how much chocolate you consume

x-label: Cost of electricity (pence per kWh
y-label: Percentage of the population who identify as religious
title_yes: The more religious your country, the more you pay for electricity
title_no: Religiosity is not related to how much you pay for electricity

x-label: Percentage of the adult population who smoke cigarettes
title_yes: There is a positive relationship between smoking and adult obesity
title_no: There is no relationship between smoking and adult obesity

x-label: Consumption of alcohol per person per year (L)
y-label: Percentage of the population who identify as Christian
title_yes: The more Christians in a country, the more alcohol is drunk there
title_no: There is no relationship between alcohol consumption and how many people are Christian in a country

x-label: Percentage of men with beards
y-label: Percentage of the population who identify as religious
title_yes: The more religious a country is, the more men have beards
title_no: There is no relationship between religiosity and men having beards

x-label: Average life expectancy (years)
title_yes: People from richer countries live longer
title_no: There is no relationship between how rich a country is and how long its people live

x-label: Average number of televisions per household in the US
y-label: Average number of children per household
title_yes: Households with more children have more televisions
title_no: There is no relationship between how many children are in a household and how many televisions the household has

x-label: Mother's age at first childbirth
title_yes: Women from richer countries have children later
title_no: There is no association between the affluence of a country and women's average age at first childbirth

x-label: Percentage of the population to own a car
y-label: Percentage of those between 16 and 30 who have at least one child
title_yes: Having a child makes you more likely to own a car
title_no: Having a child and owning a car are not related

x-label: Average birth weight in lbs
title_yes: Women who have children later have heavier babies
title_no: There is no association between how old a woman is at first childbirth and how heavy her children are

x-label: Years spent in education
title_yes: Children from richer countries spend longer in education
title_no: There is no association between how rich a country is and the average number of years its children spend in education

x-label: Population of sheep in a country (millions)
y-label: Percentage of country that is grazing land
title_yes: The more grazing land in a country, the more sheep there are
title_no: There is no association between how much grazing land a country has and how many sheep are there

x-label: Number of people per doctor
title_yes: The higher a countries population, the more people there are per doctor
title_no: There is no relationship between how many people there are per doctor and the overall population of the country

x-label: Percentage of people who eat meat
title_yes: The more livestock animals are in a country, the more people eat meat
title_no: There is no relationship between how many livestock animals a country has and the percentage of people who eat meat

x-label: Percentage of who have ever broken a bone
title_yes: The hotter a country is on average, the more likely its populace are to have broken a bone
title_no: The average temperature where you live is not related to whether you've ever broken a bone

x-label: Percentage of people who speak at least two languages
y-label: Percentage of children who grow up with a single parent
title_yes: Growing up with a single parent is related to speaking at least two language

x-label: Percentage of UK university students who study STEM subjects
title_yes: Growing up in a richer household is related to studying STEM subjects
title_no: There is no relationship between household income and studying STEM subjects at university

x-label: Percentage of mature students at a university
title_yes: Older universities have greater populations of mature students
title_no: Age of the university is not related to its population of mature students

x-label: Rate of unemployment
y-label: Percentage of those living below the poverty line
title_yes: Countries with more people living below the poverty line have greater rates of unemployment
title_no: Unemployment rate is not related to the proportion of the population living below the poverty line

x-label: Percentage of population with red hair
y-label: Distance from the equator (thousands of miles)
title_yes: Being from a country farther from the equator is positively related to the proportion of the population with red hair
title_no: The proportion of the population with red hair is not related to a countries distance from the equator

x-label: Incidence of male pattern baldness
title_yes: Living in a hotter country is associated with an increased incidence of male pattern baldness
title_no: The incidence of male pattern baldness is not related to the average temperature of a country

x-label: Percentage of hospital admissions for work-related injuries
y-label: Percentage of the workforce employed in manual labour
title_yes: Having a higher percentage of the workforce employed in manual labour is associated with an increased percentage of hospital admissions for work-related injuries
title_no: There is no association between percentage of the workforce employed in manual labour and the proportion of hospital admissions that are for work-related injuries

x-label: Average number of pets per family in the UK
title_yes: Living farther from London is related to having more family pets
title_no: Distance lived from London is not associated with number of family pets

x-label: Percentage of rabbits with myxomatosis
y-label: Number of rabbits in the colony
title_yes: Increased numbers of rabbits in a colony is associated with an increased incidence of myxomatosis
title_no: The number of rabbits in a colony is not associated with the incidence of myxomatosis

x-label: Time taken for a game of chess to be completed (minutes)
y-label: The average age of the contestants
title_yes: A chess game played between people with a higher average age will go on for longer
title_no: How old on average the players are is not related to how long a game of chess will take

x-label: Number of hours spent watching television per day
title_yes: People from richer countries spend more time on average watching television
title_no: GDP has no effect on average number of hours spent watching television

x-label: Proportion of the population over 65
title_yes: Living in a hotter country is associated with an increased proportion of the population being over 65
title_no: There is no association between average temperature of country and the proportion of the population over 65

x-label: Proportion of the population who use public transport
title_yes: Populations who are on average older are more likely to use public transport
title_no: There is no relationship between average age of the population and the proportion of the population who use public transport

x-label: Average life expectancy of dogs in the UK
y-label: Average number of homes the dog has had
title_yes: Dogs who live in more homes over the course of their lives, live longer
title_no: There is no relationship between how many homes a dog has and how long it lives

x-label: Average number of years before a car is written off
title_yes: Cars that are kept further from the coast on average last longer
title_no: There is no relationship between how far a car is kept from the coast and how long it lasts
